strong.em: All FAQ’s posted here are for the convenience of CUSD #24 families, staff and community.
Please be aware that the responses are based on the information we have available as of today
and is subject to change as conditions in Arizona and our local community change. Please check back regularly for such changes.

page-box page-box--block post-4238 page type-page status-publish has-post-thumbnail hentry
div.div:
JOIN OUR TEAM We are seeking appropriately certified, highly effective & energetic teachers and staff! Chinle Unified School District No. 24 is among the top 5 highest paying school districts in Arizona with average teacher pay for 2019 at $70,720. We value great teachers! Also enjoy beautiful scenery and outdoor recreation while living in the heart of the Navajo …
Read more

div.class: so-panel widget widget_pt_featured_page widget-featured-page panel-first-child panel-last-child
page-box page-box--block post-3812 page type-page status-publish has-post-thumbnail hentry
div.div:
About Our Schools C.U.S.D #24 has 7 schools that serve 3,600 students in grades PreK-12. We are the largest school district on the Navajo Nation in both student counts and geographic area. C.U.S.D is also the home to the largest primarily Native American public high school in the entire United States. 99% of our students are Diné. From 2015 …
Read more

div.class: page-box page-box--inline post-3940 page type-page status-publish has-post-thumbnail hentry
div.div: For Students and Parents HELPFUL RESOURCE LINKS: What can I do before my child starts …

div.p: Yá'át'ééh shik’éí dóó shidine’é! Quincy Natay yinishye. Chinle Unified School District olta’ naat’áanii aląąjí ba dasidah. Táchiinii éí nishlí, Todich’iinii éí báshishchíín, Ma’ii deeshgiizhnii éí dashicheii, Tsi’naajinii éí dashinálí. Ch’ínilįįdéé naashá.
Parents, Staff, Students, and Community Members,
I want to start by recognizing the hard work and effort provided by the Chinle Unified School District staff.

span.b: BE VALUED AS AN EFFECTIVE PROFESSIONAL EDUCATOR

span.span: CUSD invests in new teachers with a strong, paid teacher induction and follows that with job embedded growth opportunities on a weekly basis through cluster meetings and coaching for teachers through classroom observation, co planning, co teaching and modeling. Grow professionally while you build financial security for yourself as you are compensated well above the AZ state average and US national average for teacher pay.

span.b: FIND SUCCESS IN A VISION, MISSION AND GOAL DRIVEN PROFESSIONAL CULTURE

span.span: CUSD’s emphasis on vision, mission and goals in considering professional culture and professional development is above all a consideration of students and their needs. As a PLC teachers learn and plan not in isolation but in a mutually beneficial environment of professional collaboration.

span.b: MAKE HISTORY AND SEE STUDENTS FULFILL THEIR DESTINY

span.span: CUSD is a district poised for greatness. Student achievement has been steadily improving at a rate 3-5 times greater than that of the State of Arziona as a whole. At this rate we will close the achievement gap for the first time in a high poverty, high minority district. Join our team to be a part of this crucial work – change lives & make history!

so-panel widget widget_ess-grid-widget widget_ess_grid panel-first-child panel-last-child

em.strong: Respectful relationships between students, parents, community and district personnel.
A safe environment that promotes relevant academic, social and emotional growth for all.
Proactive, collaborative engagement that promotes high student achievement.
Accountability, integrity, dedication and commitment for all with a focus on student success.

Our vision is to empower all students to be Competitive, Unique, Successful, and Driven through an effective team of teachers, staff, school board, parents and community; in an environment dedicated to the value of continuous learning.
We can make a difference in student achievement.
We have resources to provide a quality education.
In promoting strong partnerships with families and communities.
That our students can be productive citizens in the 21st Century.
That students should develop a strong identity and respect for cultural diversity.
